itemDescription: British-Indian recipient of the Victoria Cross (1920-1944)

wikipedia_page.main: Frank Gerald Blaker VC MC (8 May 1920 – 9 July 1944) was a British-Indian recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

response: *Frank Blaker, Victoria Cross recipient, born in Kasauli"Known graves of holders of The Victoria Cross - Frank Gerald Blaker", Victoriacross.org.uk. Retrieved 6 February 2014
